alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Johnson; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 12:25AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Scott, west central Clinton, Cedar and northeastern Johnson Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1225 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Branch, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rochester around 1245 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Tipton and Bennett. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 247 and 269. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
